I’d give six stars if I could. This place is overflowing with personality and character. And it’s comfortable! This is a downtown loft with the entrance in the back and convenient parking in a nearby garage. I recommend downloading the app for the parking garage to make it simpler to pay. Yes you will hear ambient downtown sounds - people talking,laughing, cars, music - but it was not at all disturbing for us.
The place cleverly places the (large, luxurious, jaw dropping) bathroom at the front facing the street so the rooms where you spend the most time are quieter. Bonus: there was a man playing saxophone across the street both evenings of our stay and it made for incredible atmosphere, especially for soaking in the tub.
The rooms are very spacious with very high ceilings. There are skylights in most rooms, so if you like a dark room in which to sleep in this may not be the best choice for you, but I loved it. The hosts provided white noise machines to help diffuse the ambient city noise but honestly it was not bad during the weekend we stayed. I was not disturbed at all. (Take ear plugs if you have concerns about this!)
Coffee is always necessary for us, and the hosts provide a great one cup machine that uses pods or grounds. So be sure to bring your favorite coffee with you. They even have a French press if you prefer.
The bedding is fantastic, especially the pillows! The mattress in the master is somewhat firm, but very comfortable. The hosts are very kind, welcoming, and quick to respond. We would most definitely stay here again.

There are some wonderful amenities including location to downtown for the apartment but renters considering this location should be aware it is located 2 storefronts from Peaches which is a rowdy concert venue. A band playing until midnight or 2am depending on the night would not be in my opinion as the description says downtown noise. While you do not hear the sounds of people you will hear the bass instruments if trying to sleep. If you’re coming to enjoy the nightlife and coming home after partying then it’s probably not going to be an issue (be aware no alcohol is allowed in the apartment if you are a rule follower). However if you are expecting to sleep in the master anytime before midnight even a white noise app didn’t mask the background beats of the band. Car engine comes and goes, people talking and laughing while walking by…those to me are downtown noises…
Also not shared…street parking is free from 6pm until 8am the next morning which then starts a 3 hour time limit. Useful information if you are moving your car before 11am the next morning and don’t want to park a block away in the garage.
Dog walking trails are conveniently located and it’s fun to be near downtown. Just be aware of the reality of the location and potential for sleep disruption when making a decision about where to stay. You can check the concert schedule on Peaches web site…wish I had known before spending so much money to book a place leaving me sleep deprived.
